showerReviews.reviewText: Great family fun, friendly staff. We left out bags under the trailer where you pay as the staff member said she doesnâ€™t leave the area (there are lockers but they are behind the wave pool). Not many people when we went, maybe 20 of us, so that was good. Everyone had a laugh stacking it. We did hurt our feet/knees on the â€˜stepsâ€™ climbing up a few of the obstacles, you seem to put your feet on top of the white handles but if you slide down then you really knock yourself on them and they hurt! Overall great fun & highly recommend!

locations.title: Casuarina Aquatics and Leisure Centre (Casuarina Pool)

showerReviews.reviewText:
They did a great job with the upgrade, much better quality than the one in Palmerston. The maintenance is great too, the pools are so clean and not too much chlorine. The 25m pool also not too hot.
They have half basketball court, bbq bike rack, places to do some picnic.
There are more shower rooms too, which is handy.
Entry fee is $6 for adults.
showerReviews.author: J Seth

showerReviews.reviewText: Excellent facility! Excellent upgrades. Although change rooms are still small, not enough toilets or showers or bench space. External seating average, more options needed. Shaded car parks with solar wouldâ€™ve been genius. However- Quality of pools, staff, new change rooms, accessible facilities and plenty of room are excellent. Great for rehab, laps, recovery. Much needed after the old pool. Well priced entry fee.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very nice area with plenty of space for kids and adults. We went late in the afternoon and there werenâ€™t many people. All the facilities look great.

The kiosk seems much smaller than the Nightcliff one, but you have the shopping centre nearby so you can pop over and get some snacks before you swim.

Plenty of free parking available right outside.

We usually visit the Nightcliff pool but may switch and go here more frequently instead as they have both a 25 and 50 metre swimming pool. The kids play area is hugely improved compared to Nightcliff.

showerReviews.reviewText: 3/5 only because the young cap at the front counter today needs some upskilling in customer service and retention or find a job that doesn't require you to be in such a role. other than that the place looks great. very accessible for all ages and abilities. it has a gym attached to it as well as a half court for basketball. empty rooms - not sure what for. a play ground, a wet play area. a huge shallow pool for kids and the two main pools. swimming classes on offer. plenty of bbq facilities. the bathrooms were clean. for the most part things are pretty shaded but i wish they would have more shade in the lush grass areas especially in this climate, being sun smart is everything! many families bought their own shade/tent because there just isn't enough for everyone and it wasnt even really a busy day. great job over all.

showerReviews.reviewText: My wife and I plus our 2.5 year old daughter love the kids / toddler pool very spacious with depth heights perfect for beginners or intermediate kids of toddler age. Only thing is I could see on the days I have been is older kids and adults enjoying the pool also who probably should have been in the bigger pool more suited to their ages or styles of swimming. Also the lighting after 6:30pm is ok but could be more central to the pool and not just the walkways around the toddler pool as the centre doesnâ€™t close until 7:30pm but light fades around 6:30pm. I also was thinking that maybe if you are an adult and would like to swim in the kids pool that you could firstly take a shower or rinse off in the supplied change sheds before taking a swim, as I had seen a couple of adults washing themselves in the pool, not very hygienic for the kids in that situation. Other than that I would rate it 9/10 for the smokes and laughter it brings to my daughter.
showerReviews.author: Stephen Jarvis

showerReviews.reviewText: Great fun. Never too old to be a child. Grab a tube and bounce up and down with the waves. Theyâ€™re pretty strong actually. Multiple lifeguards. They have lockers but bathrooms to change outside. Drink and snack stand. showerReviews.reviewText: Really fun for the kids and adults alike! Staff are friendly, there are lockers inside the fenced area for a fee (self-serving and only big enough for small bags), lounge chairs and some bench seats. No toilets or change rooms inside, you have to leave and go to the toilets near the beach lagoon. Your entry fee is for the whole day, just keep your wrist band on. Waves are every 15 minutes and last 15 minutes. Super fun and you can bring your own ring tube. There's a kiosk for drinks and food. A nice day out.
showerReviews.author: Kim S

showerReviews.reviewText:
This place has it's ups and downs.

The waves are every 20 mins.
Lockers available
Changing rooms, clean
Ditto showers and toilets

Lifeguards are like meerkats, highly attentive to persons in the water and this was very encouraging.

The grounds are very tidy and pretty, but there's a stunning lack of chairs and seating.

Beware the rough surface of the wave pool floor, as this may lead to scrapes and scratches.
showerReviews.author: Ian Jordan

showerReviews.reviewText:
One of the most beautiful pool locations in the world.
Go for a few laps, enjoy the lawn and fantastic view. You have to go to major international cities to get this kind of pool with a view, many have the pool, almost none have the view.
50m, good lane markings, great water, par-for-the-course change rooms. Oh, yes, right next door to a dazzling cafe/restaurant on the promenade of nightcliff..
At closing time the sunsets are special, especially from the pool.

locations.title: Parap Swimming Pool
locations.address: îƒˆ77 Ross Smith Ave, Parap NT 0820

showerReviews.reviewText:
From my overall experience I rate the Parap swimming pool based on initial customer service on entry, facilities and availability of equipment, change areas and overall ground presentation and cleanliness
I had to wait 5 minutes at reception for a customer service person to pay my entry fee, price varies and there are senior discounts
50 metre outdoor pool has varied lane availability for lap swimmers. Depth is approximately 1.4metres in shallow entrance and has walk down ramp for those with physical incapacity. The 25 metre outdoor pool also has ramp access. Water temperature during my visit in March 2025 was ok, like swimming with the light rain falling. Part of the 50 metre outdoor pool is under cover. Grounds and grass areas looked unkept and could do with a maintenance. Change room and showers rate 3 for cleanliness. There are seats and tables for non swimmers. A kiosk has snack options, very basic. No equipment was available for use and/or hire (kickboard and noodles). When I inquired with lifeguard the response was gruff and off putting.
showerReviews.author: Murray River

locations.title: SWELL Palmerston (Palmerston Pool and Gym)

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just to start off, I've had a pleasant experience talking to staff and attending Swell for over a year now, which makes this all the more disappointing. Ever since you have reopened last year, the site and google shows that the pool is open until 9pm. I have verbally been told that the pool closes half an hour earlier but that facilities do not shut down until the displayed time on your site and google. This is what I have been told in my 1+ year of attending Swell.

On Friday 14/3/2025 I was out of the pool by 8:30pm, left the bathroom after changing by 8:40. Then I was walking near the lockers waiting to be picked up by my father.  The duty manager OJ approached me and told me that I need to leave the facilities and go outside. I've been going to swell for well over a year now and not once have I been told to leave the premises (the pool, yes half an hour earlier than advertised, not the premises though)

OJ told me again that I needed to wait outside. When I told him I was waiting for my ride he relented and changed his statement to, okay just wait near the waiting area.

Since I've never been told this before and it has never been advertised anywhere on the facilities or on your site/online I was a bit bewildered and asked out of curiosity if that was company policy?  OJ said that the pool closes at 8:30pm, okay I know that. I asked about the facilities itself/waiting outside the pool before the actual advertised closing time which I've seen many other customers do and never once has a staff member asked them to leave in the last year.

After further inquiry OJ became very passive aggressive and dismissive of my inquiry, I reassured him and the others that I am simply frustrated with the miscommunication and lack of advertising/informing of actual company policy regarding the facilities and closing times. OJ then very rudely stated that he already told me to leave and that the pool closes at 8:30pm, I already know this, I wasn't confused about the bloody pool closing, I was wondering why I was asked to leave the facilities and wait outside to be picked up when this has never once happened before and I and other customers have been allowed to wait until the ACTUAL advertised closing time.

OJ then said that he can't have me waiting near the desk and asked me to leave the facilities and go outside before 9pm because the employees count the money at the end of the day? What kind of logic is that?

The other employees on duty told me that they understand, and that other customers have sent feedback about this, but failed to understand how my issue was not just with false advertising, it was with being asked to leave the facilities when all I was doing is waiting to be picked up BEFORE the advertising closing time and NOT once have I been told to leave for the last year by other staff. Never had to deal with disrespect from the staff at Swell until today either.

OJ's behaviour was very childish and the junior employees behaviour was quite frustrating and dismissive, OJ was extremely passive aggressive and dismissive of my inquiry and concern and pushed me to a point of great frustration. While two other employees dismissively told me that they've had to wait outside after closing time. I very clearly communicated multiple times that my problem is not with waiting outside after closing time. It's with being told to wait outside and leave BEFORE closing time and then having to deal with a manager that can't admit that his behaviour was unprofessional and extremely rude. OJ also passive aggressively asked me if I'm going to remain here until closing and smiled when I asked him why he's being passive aggressive. What a nutter.

I have never been more disappointed with the customer service and policy at Swell until today. Which is unfortunate because for over a year the staff have been nothing but polite and respectful and don't ask you to leave the waiting area until the actual bloody closing time. I'd like an apology from Swell and from OJ who needs to grow up. And for the love of god, CLEAR UP when you're closed!
showerReviews.author: Mr.2099 -

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just to start off, I've had a pleasant experience talking to staff and attending Swell for over a year now, which makes this all the more disappointing. Ever since you have reopened last year, the site and google shows that the pool is open until 9pm. I have verbally been told that the pool closes half an hour earlier but that facilities do not shut down until the displayed time on your site and google. This is what I have been told in my 1+ year of attending Swell.

On Friday 14/3/2025 I was out of the pool by 8:30pm, left the bathroom after changing by 8:40. Then I was walking near the lockers waiting to be picked up by my father.  The duty manager OJ approached me and told me that I need to leave the facilities and go outside. I've been going to swell for well over a year now and not once have I been told to leave the premises (the pool, yes half an hour earlier than advertised, not the premises though)

OJ told me again that I needed to wait outside. When I told him I was waiting for my ride he relented and changed his statement to, okay just wait near the waiting area.

Since I've never been told this before and it has never been advertised anywhere on the facilities or on your site/online I was a bit bewildered and asked out of curiosity if that was company policy?  OJ said that the pool closes at 8:30pm, okay I know that. I asked about the facilities itself/waiting outside the pool before the actual advertised closing time which I've seen many other customers do and never once has a staff member asked them to leave in the last year.

After further inquiry OJ became very passive aggressive and dismissive of my inquiry, I reassured him and the others that I am simply frustrated with the miscommunication and lack of advertising/informing of actual company policy regarding the facilities and closing times. OJ then very rudely stated that he already told me to leave and that the pool closes at 8:30pm, I already know this, I wasn't confused about the bloody pool closing, I was wondering why I was asked to leave the facilities and wait outside to be picked up when this has never once happened before and I and other customers have been allowed to wait until the ACTUAL advertised closing time.

OJ then said that he can't have me waiting near the desk and asked me to leave the facilities and go outside before 9pm because the employees count the money at the end of the day? What kind of logic is that?

The other employees on duty told me that they understand, and that other customers have sent feedback about this, but failed to understand how my issue was not just with false advertising, it was with being asked to leave the facilities when all I was doing is waiting to be picked up BEFORE the advertising closing time and NOT once have I been told to leave for the last year by other staff. Never had to deal with disrespect from the staff at Swell until today either.

OJ's behaviour was very childish and the junior employees behaviour was quite frustrating and dismissive, OJ was extremely passive aggressive and dismissive of my inquiry and concern and pushed me to a point of great frustration. While two other employees dismissively told me that they've had to wait outside after closing time. I very clearly communicated multiple times that my problem is not with waiting outside after closing time. It's with being told to wait outside and leave BEFORE closing time and then having to deal with a manager that can't admit that his behaviour was unprofessional and extremely rude. OJ also passive aggressively asked me if I'm going to remain here until closing and smiled when I asked him why he's being passive aggressive. What a nutter.

I have never been more disappointed with the customer service and policy at Swell until today. Which is unfortunate because for over a year the staff have been nothing but polite and respectful and don't ask you to leave the waiting area until the actual bloody closing time. I'd like an apology from Swell and from OJ who needs to grow up. And for the love of god, CLEAR UP when you're closed!
showerReviews.author: Mr.2099 -

showerReviews.reviewText:
Love swimming in the open air.
2 pools - one 20m and the other 50m. Plus a children's water play area.
Small pool is heated and not really deep, great for walking, exercising or just lolling around.
50m pool has 5 swimming lanes, is deep and quite busy. Lots of groups just enjoying the cooler water.
Wear sunscreen at all times.
There has been issues with the cleanliness of changerooms, but hopefully all sorted now.
Whiteboard as you enter let's you know if different areas have been booked at different times during the day.
Not much interaction with staff.
Usually 2 life guards on duty.
Best thing is it is FREE!!
Well done Palmerston city council.
showerReviews.author: Linda Weber

Donâ€™t worry about cleaning supplies though â€” they donâ€™t have any. Sweaty benches are apparently part of the â€œauthentic hardcore vibe.â€

The staff? Oh, theyâ€™re greatâ€¦ at scrolling Instagram behind the counter while you struggle to figure out if the elliptical is supposed to make that grinding noise (spoiler: itâ€™s not). If you ask for help, expect a sigh so dramatic it deserves an Oscar.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The initial welcome did not go well, as we were not booked into the room we had chosen. Staff tried hard to sooth us and work out a solution.
We wanted the lagoon room with the swim out pool. My fellow traveller has mobility issues and does not cope with stairs.
The selected room had 4 stairs down to it which she knew about.
Our booked room was upstairs on the resort side.
We stayed in the hotel side fir our first night and moved into the lagoon room the next day.
With rooms were beautiful. A shower chair was provided when requested.
The lagoon pool is wonderful and the swim out bar, fun.
The pool ladder was too difficult for my friend to use and she exited via the beach. Walking on sand and shells without a hand rail was hard and difficult for her.
The availability of golf carts to transport us was greatly appreciated and used regularly.
Breakfast was great and included in the price.
The casino complex has  good resources but it also has a variety of levels to access. Ramps are available in some spots.
The infinity pool was wonderful and easy to access. Unfortunately the toilet and change area was down steep stairs.
The restaurants there and room service provided interesting meals.
Staff were super friendly and accommodating. We had a great experience but I am not sure we would book the lagoon resort side again.
showerReviews.author: Sandra Macgregor

showerReviews.reviewText:
Date of event: 9/10/2025

My partner and I entered the building and headed to the reception to enquire where the pool entrance was. Before the lady on reception could respond to me, the security woman stood outside the casino door came over in a very rude manor to tell me I couldnâ€™t be here â€œlike thisâ€ and needed to get a tshirt on. (For reference I was wearing shorts, crocs, a bikini top and towel around my shoulder)she kept repeating over and over in a tone that I needed to get a top on. (All whilst I was getting my top on). The receptionist apologised for her behaviour, and directed us to the pool. As the receptionist was explaining the details of the pool, the security guard (Marina I think her name was) was still stood behind me rabbiting on to her colleague â€œshe canâ€™t come in like thatâ€.
I turned around to say â€œwhy are you still going on, Iâ€™ve put my tshirt on and there was no signage to state I couldnâ€™t be at reception without a top on I was simply asking for directionsâ€.

She was in a huff and puff and continued to have a tone. I explained itâ€™s a good job we wasnâ€™t looking to book a night here as the first interaction was terrible!!!! Not what you expect for such a high end resort. Thatâ€™s no way to treat guests.

Props to the receptionist, she was fully capable of doing her job without the security guard coming over.

On the other hand, the pool was great
showerReviews.author: Shanice

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hotel room we had came with a nice view if the beach and is larger than your average hotel room these days, but it's attractions ended thete. The rooms are in need of renovation having older furniture, paint missing off the bathroom door and scale and dirt around the shower screen.

The room was noisy from the neighbours as well as from a large air-conditioning unit in the atrium outside the door.

Despite these clear drawbacks though, the rooms come with a distinctly high-end price tag that can't be justified.

Uf you want a nice, quiet hotel room at a more reasonable rate, go elsewhere in Darwin. I shan't be back.

I would have considered joining, but pricing is way too high and paying $60 to use my old access card is ridiculous.

Here's some feedback and things to consider.

1. Have toilets have sanitary wipes because they are unisex.

2. The pricing of memberships seems over priced.

3. It would be great to see members actually practising good hygiene rituals by sanitising their equipment after usage. (I saw 10% members cleaning machines ðŸ˜³)

4. Having members taking full responsibility and racking their weights correctly and not relying on staff to do this.

Thanks again for considering my recommendations and having me at your gym. Appreciate it ðŸ˜Š

locations.title: Nightcliff Beach

showerReviews.reviewText:
I lived in Nightcliff for 16 years and my family and I spent many days playing on Nightcliff beach. The sunsets are truly magical ðŸ’›ðŸ§¡
I don't recommend swimming as there are crocodiles around, but when the tide goes out there's lots of little pools of shallow water the kids can splash in.

It's a great place for a family picnic or a romantic stroll on the beach. There's usually food vans along the Nighcliff foreshore most days making it a great place to grab a meal and watch the sunset.

Plenty of picnic tables and electric BBQs available and public toilets at various locations along the foreshore.
showerReviews.author: Jody Maguire

locations.title: Lee Point Beach
locations.address: îƒˆLee Point Picnic Parking Loop, Lee Point NT 0810

showerReviews.reviewText:
A great place for bird and nature nerds like myself. However be prepared for sandflys and mosquitos with insect repellent. In dry season it's a great hangout for walks, wildlife wonder and beautiful beaches (no swimming unless you want to come up close and personal with a saltwater crocodile....   definitely not recomended... always be #Crocwise.)

Also there is a bird hide for shorebird season, coming up soon in Darwin.

Sunset gazing, and rock hole exploring is viable.

In build up it can feel very challenging but then in wet season it is also magical. Bring your binoculars but leave your dog at home. From the point east it is a no doggy area. Hopefully nature lovers like myself around the world will be able to #saveleepoint from the bulldozers so we can truly call Darwin home to some great nature.
showerReviews.author: Betty Bird

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here for 2 weeks and had made 4 separate bookings as our road trip plan changed. On arrival, the staff were very nice and suggested we stay on the cheaper site for the entire stay to save us from moving around as we made 4 bookings. However, they didnâ€™t mention the rate difference or offer any credit.

When we asked, we were told the price had changed between the time we booked and when we arrived â€“ which wasnâ€™t true, as the same rates were still showing online. After 30 minutes of going back and forth, management finally agreed to issue a credit, but not for the full amount.

In the end, the credit was never processed. Their T&Cs stated credits could only be used in Darwin Discovery Park, but weâ€™ve stayed at Discovery Parks many times before and credits could always be used across locations. Also, they refused to give coins credit for the use of washing machine because â€œhow do we know you will use the coin in our washing machineâ€
We are making this review not because of the credit amount but for the handling of the situation, felt dodgy and left a very poor impression.

Unfortunately, this was the worst customer service weâ€™ve experienced at a Discovery Park.
showerReviews.author: Phuong Le

locations.title: Courtyard by Marriott Darwin
locations.address: îƒˆ81 Smith St, Darwin City NT 0800

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel for a business trip during the off-season. Overall, the experience was mixed but pleasant. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout my stay, which made a great first impression.

The on-site restaurant was a great - quiet, with a lovely view over the pool area, and perfect to relax during the day. The gym was also well equipped for a hotel, which I appreciated.

The room itself was spacious and clean, but unfortunately very dark and limited natural light (Level 1). The biggest downside was the bed, which was quiet lumpy and uncomfortable, marking it hard to get a decent night's sleep. On the positive side, the bathroom was spotless and well stocked with quality amenities.

Overall, a comfortable stay with good services and facilities but not the best Courtyard by Marriott I've stayed in.
showerReviews.author: Corey Matthews

locations.title: BIG4 Hidden Valley Holiday Park
locations.address: îƒˆ25 Hidden Valley Rd, Berrimah NT 0828

showerReviews.reviewText:
This park has both an established and new section.  The established area is shady whereas the new section has some trees but offers little or no shade.  The latter area is where you will be located if you have a dog.   That said the facilities in the new area are obviously new and clean and the sites are large and grassed with staff working hard to maintain cleanliness and grass.  Shower stalls are huge and water pressure is great.
The park is located about 15 min from Darwin.   It is near the airport but we had no issues with noise.
Pool area is great.
Once the trees grow in the new area it will be an all over great park
showerReviews.author: Peter Hill

showerReviews.reviewText: The location of this park was good, easy to drive in to Darwin and we used uber more than once and they were not too expensive . The bottom section of the park, where we stayed, is pretty crowded,  with little shade and inadequate amenities for the numbers of travellers staying there. Camp kitchen is too small, very basic and could do with more shelter. Toilets and showers were not overly clean, they were well used and needed attention from cleaners more frequently. Sometimes no soap in dispensers. We found reception staff were quite uninterested in us in general, not friendly and one lady was rude. The top section  looked lovely, pool area was nice.
showerReviews.author: Jane Furnell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our studio queen room was clean and the bed was comfortable, the shower was a good size with good water pressure and  shower head. The climate control system kept the room at a pleasant temperature all night, but the walls could not keep the sounds of the partying neighbours out.
We enjoyed a dip in the nice pool and the meals we chose were very nice. Our room had a small fridge with a small milk there were a few coffee sachets, tea bags, sugar a toaster but no butter or jam mini sachets.
The city is quite a way of but for me we were close to where we needed to be.
showerReviews.author: Athfos

showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently celebrated our daughter 1st birthday at Darwin FreeSpirit Resort, and it honestly couldnâ€™t have been a more perfect venue. From start to finish, the experience was seamless, convenient, and just what we needed for a special day with family and friends.

The air-conditioned function room was spacious, clean, and beautifully lit with natural light, which made it super comfortable for both kids and adults (especially in Darwinâ€™s heat!). The location is ideal, easy for guests to get to, with plenty of parking and a relaxed, tropical vibe as soon as you enter the resort.

We had external vendors come in to set up soft play and decorations, and the team at FreeSpirit was so flexible and accommodatingâ€”nothing was too hard, and they really helped take the stress out of the day. Every staff member we spoke to was friendly, professional, and genuinely supportive. You can tell they care about their guests having a great experience.

The food was delicious and came out exactly on timeâ€”hot, fresh, and with generous portions. We had so many compliments from our guests!

Whether youâ€™re hosting a birthday, baby shower, or any type of event, I canâ€™t recommend Darwin FreeSpirit Resort enough. The atmosphere is chilled but polished, and itâ€™s a place where you can truly enjoy the moment while the team takes care of the rest.

Thanks again to the FreeSpirit team for helping make our little girlâ€™s first birthday one weâ€™ll never forget ðŸ’•ðŸŒ´

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a disaster this place was! I will preface this by saying that Sylvia who only took over the management last week, this  is not a reflection of on you.
This park is not worth the money. The sites are small and everyone is crowded on top of each other. The amenities are abysmal and after 8 days the same crap was still in the plug holes in the showers. A very poor attempt was made to blow the leaves away (which are in abundance and we understand that this is a nightmare to keep on top of) the pool was HEATED!!!!! Can you believe it? 31* humidity 45%, no need for this.
We did need to change our booking which was done and we were thankful but sitting outside our van at 10:30 we got a call to say we should have checked out at 10:00am and they said they didnâ€™t have any sites left for us. I quickly found another park and booked in. We packed up and then the young groundsman came and said they found a site for us. Too late! When our friends checked out she was spoken to very rudely. Seriously, this place needs to be demolished and rebuilt. So disappointing!
showerReviews.author: Denise Gorrel

locations.address: îƒˆ170 Whitewood Rd, Howard Springs NT 0835

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great Park to stay, has everything you need and want and more. We originally booked for 8 nights and ended up staying 15 nights.
Mark was a fabulous host and was willing help when needed.
Coffee van in the park was a winner, friendly folk and great coffee and yummy cookies.
Ensuite style amenities are a winner for me! Pools are fabulous, camp kitchen well set up.
Our site had lovely green grass, was well shaded and close to everything in the park.
Pet Friendly and had a Dog Sitter 2 streets away at a great price.
It was an easy straight run into Darwin from here also.
I would definitely recommend this park!! Steve & Rhonda
showerReviews.author: Rhonda McCormick

The amenities are super dated and not good at all and the lights are on a very short timer so if using them at night be prepared to finish your shower in the dark unless another camper helps you out, which we all did. There are heaps of shops across the road like Coles and Kmart and also a big laundromat. The cinema is about 5 or so minutes up the road. Very convenient to everything.

Stayed 8 nights, nice quiet park, central to so much
Amenities well they are old, they are clean, plenty of hot water, water pressure near non existing when more than one stall used together, exposed plumbing means easy to contact hot water supply, really why do half a job guys very much  "Faulty Towers"
Forgot to take gate pin for after hours entry contacted via after hours number, and messaged via sms, thank God another resident came along as I didn't get a response till mid morning the following day
Over all a nice convenient park that with a little bit of tlc would have so much potential

locations.title: Noonamah Tourist Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
We originally booked for two nights, stayed for one.  On paper this place ticks all the boxes, upon arrival we were badly let down, we decided to go out for the day in our motorhome and left our grass door mat out for our return only to find it had been stolen, the reception lady was friendly and helpful. For the remainder of the evening we we're afraid to leave our van unattended. We left the next morning with a refund, and I noticed on the way out OUR MAT under the steps of one of the permanants.
Apart from the obvious theft at the park, the toilet/shower blocks were old and dirty. Not value for money at $55, there are much nicer places to stay for less or the same money.
showerReviews.author: Adele

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great little campground, close to the waterfall. $15 per night per person & you need to book online don't just turn up & think you can camp anywhere.
Showers are meant to be hot but are a little chilly, no camp fires in your site only the communal one
John & Jill are the camp hosts lovely people.
Wangi falls was closed for swimming due to high water & crocs

showerReviews.reviewText:
What an absolute gem of a camp! The photos do not do this little camp any justice, especially as I did a video & cannot upload currently.
Stayed at camp 3 for 5 nights last week, cutest set up with all the luxuries.... Open air hot shower, dunny with a view & cool bath tubs! Very well set up, clean, they supplied mozzie coils & loo paper! Little trickets along the path ways!
You must give this place a stay! We will be back!
FYI tho we did not meet the hosts as we were adventuring too much, they were great with their check ins and I really appreciate that!
Thankyou for having us!! Xox
showerReviews.author: Teegan Priede

The campsite however said there were hot showers and that wasnâ€™t the case, they were single push button showers and the temp was always cold. We quite liked our stay as it was a great place to drive to the other attractions.

showerReviews.reviewText:
A great campground if you are looking to explore Litchfield National Park. The issue i found with this campsite in the past is that, especially in the dry season, you have to secure a spot on early Friday afternoon if you want it for the weekend. It is unlikely to get a spot on a Saturday, however saying that I have got one by chance on a Saturday.
Anyway, beautiful, a short walk to the water fall.
It has showers and toilets there and all the campsites have a fire place.
You can collect wood on the main roads on the way to the campsites. Dont grab wood from the bushes near the campsite, you may get fined if caught.
You cannot book here, its first in best dressed.
Lots of wild life and not too many flies ðŸ˜
Enjoy!!!!
showerReviews.author: TheSimonMech

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have camped a lot. This camp site was really mediocre. I say this for a variety of reasons including, but not necessarily limited to, the following:
- Our allocated site (9) was tiny and barely fit the tent and car, there was no way we could have safely lit a fire or set up a shelter or anything additional.
- The campsites all sit directly on the bitumen road - they are not protected, secluded or hidden whatsoever. Cars and people going past were noisy and intrusive. There is no privacy.
- The campsite ground surface was pure rock, with smaller rocks scattered on top - you could not place a single peg in the ground, one sharp rock damaged the tent floor, and our daughter injured her knee merely from playing on the ground.
- Our allotted site (9) was infested with ants.
- The sites were jammed in super close to one another meaning we were up til 1am listening to our drinking neighbours.

One positive - the showers were reasonable.

On balance, would not recommend this site.
showerReviews.author: William Lugg

showerReviews.reviewText: Great little spot right next to Florence Falls, walkable to both Florence Falls and Buley Rockhole. $15 a night per person, paid to the National Park. Has flush toilets, clean bathrooms, washing area and camping pits. The site size vary quite a bit so be sure to check the space online before booking. A bit tricky to pitch tents as it can be very stony and you won't be able to peg it out, so a tent that doesn't require too many pegs might be the way to go. Busy campground during peak season.
showerReviews.author: Wendy

Nice campground, come on time in high season.
Nice spots, fire pits in almost every spot. Clean toilets and showers. Showers don't have much water, it's more a freshing up, and no hot water (not needed with the heath ;) ). There are dingo's about, saw several pretty close to the road and entrance and they howl at night. But they don't steal. Just know they are close and lock your food up. Keep them wild ;)

(I am a light sleeper) the staff at reception were always nice and helpful at all times. Overall a great stay. I am hoping that they will eventually also refurbished the BBQ area and maybe add in a microwave there which could be handy for some guest. The stairs and ramps also need some love but the rooms were very nice. Would stay here again

locations.title: MOM Darwin
locations.address: îƒˆ7/52 Mitchell St, Darwin City NT 0800

showerReviews.reviewText: Got here after long flights hoping for a rest - no luck. Woken up at 6am every day from extremely loud construction outside (screen) window as hostel doing works to their building with tradies coming in and out of the hostel from 6am-4pm (not public construction like they say on Google reviews when others have complained!). Bad atmosphere in hostel itself, mostly long-term stays not travellers. Kitchen really badly equipped, you struggle to find a knife to chop with, and the washing up liquid is so watered down it felt unsanitary. You can rent a cutlery set from the hostel but the staff didnâ€™t explain any of this when we got there so we just bought our own. Passive aggressive notes everywhere complaining about mess in the kitchen and threatening to fine you. I could excuse all of the above if it wasnâ€™t for what Iâ€™m about to say. We were due to leave Darwin on our last day at 7am for a tour down to Litchfield NP. Hostel sends out email 3pm the previous day saying theyâ€™re doing â€œemergencyâ€ works and thereâ€™ll be no water whatsoever to entire property 5-7am. I asked staff what we should do as this included no flushing toilets, no ability to get water in kitchen etc. and we needed to leave before 7. They said use toilet at 4:50am. Just outrageous and inappropriate, especially with how much this place costs. We had to leave and book a new place for the night - I asked for a partial refund for this last night we wouldnâ€™t be there and they said no. Just donâ€™t bother - stay somewhere else this is honestly not worth the (literal) headache. I came all the way from England to see Darwin and itâ€™s so sad that this experience put a dampener on my precious time there. Donâ€™t make the mistake i did. Photos attached of room, view of construction through screen, tradesperson access into hostel and construction site (windows of majority of hostel rooms!).
showerReviews.author: Mimi Cross

showerReviews.reviewText: My partner and I stayed there one night and unsurprisingly didn't have a good night of sleep. But you get what you pay for. We were in a 4-bed dorm which was very noisy even with the windows closed. Fortunately the AIRCON was WORKING, because it was really hot in the small room.The sink (see photo attached) in the room is convenient but NOT CLEAN.Lots of MOULD everywhere. On the 2nd floor, there was only one shower and toilet accessible. Really slippery in there, and we could hear water from the shower dripping. We had our shower on the 1st floor, but there was NO HOT WATER.About the customer service, the afternoon staff member was really helpful and welcoming, whereas the night and morning ones weren't that much.For the incl. breakfast, there was bread, jam, butter, coffee and milk that you could get from the ground floor.Very NICE sauna area.

showerReviews.reviewText: My partner and I stayed there one night and unsurprisingly didn't have a good night of sleep. But you get what you pay for. We were in a 4-bed dorm which was very noisy even with the windows closed. Fortunately the AIRCON was WORKING, because it was really hot in the small room.The sink (see photo attached) in the room is convenient but NOT CLEAN.Lots of MOULD everywhere. On the 2nd floor, there was only one shower and toilet accessible. Really slippery in there, and we could hear water from the shower dripping. We had our shower on the 1st floor, but there was NO HOT WATER.About the customer service, the afternoon staff member was really helpful and welcoming, whereas the night and morning ones weren't that much.For the incl. breakfast, there was bread, jam, butter, coffee and milk that you could get from the ground floor.Very NICE sauna area.
showerReviews.author: Violaine Pourreau

showerReviews.reviewText:
Rented a double room at Chillies, the sister shack of Youthshack.
Bit of a mixed bag: the bed was comfortable, TV and AC worked, but overpriced for the quality of room. The shared showers and toilets were unpleasant; the cleaners not helpful shutting loos off at essential hours. Shocking noise disturbance outside bedroom window - adjacent small alley. Can't work out why staff have to be cheap on courtesy? Oh wait, a pleasant customer service attitude is too difficult to serve up. In fairness, Chillies would suit some folk but not others. Suggest guests buy utensils from Supermarket next door, because the refundable $10 utensil charge is a hassle.
showerReviews.author: Michael Bell

showerReviews.reviewText:
Most staff are extremely friendly and very helpful.  Must be tough explaining same questions all day but it did not faze thr front desk.

Older staff member, male wondering around with weight of the world on his shoulder's,  smiling is free.

The building looks rundown. There are broken furnishings and the astro turf looks unclean.
Kitchen is ok looks great after the cleaners been through. No cutlery or cups and plates are available.  But can be hires for a deposit.
Showers pretty good and clean.

BUT. This backpackers has to be the worst i have come across, NO Recycling at all that is visable. This day and age come on . The black plastic lined garbage bins in kitchen have all food bottles plastic bags etc. Just spoils the whole place. Would definitely have to reconsider staying here again. 2023 even the most uneducated ppl are trying.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Staffs are exceptionally helpful and professional. Manager, Hana tried her best to accommodate feedback and request. We experienced noisy guests stayed next to our room and at the upper floor unfortunately during our stay. Hotel has a decent swimming pool that you can enjoy.

My suggestions are to watch out the guests that bring glasses to the pool, place a clock in swimming pool area, consider to keep ear plugs to sell/ provide to the guests if they need urgently.

Thanks for the hospitality.

showerReviews.reviewText:
GOOD PLACE TO STAY
First time in Darwin and I lucked out with this hotel. I stayed for seven nights and was very happy with everything, although I did move rooms as I found standing in the bath to shower too slippery. The price was amazing and included continental breakfast. The plunge pool was a nice luxury. The rooms were large and comfortable: walk-in shower, dry bar with good sized fridge, glasses and cups, work desk and balcony.
It seems to be a long-stay kind of place, but the lack of kitchen sink and microwave/hotplate would limit that for me (however, you can use the communal microwave in the breakfast room).
The king bed was very comfortable and the pillows and towels were fine. Wifi was included and undercover parking was available for a fee. Walking to the city centre took about 15 minutes, but there were restaurants and grocery stores nearby.
Receptionists were helpful and welcoming.
showerReviews.author: Linda Bentley (The Packed Bag)

showerReviews.reviewText: I booked a package holiday with a reputable company that concluded with the 3 nights in Darwin. The holiday up to this point was filled with 1st class service and experiences.  Then we got to the vibe hotel. On the positive side, the location is great and the breakfast nice. Thatâ€™s about it though. On check in, I asked about a late check out (our flights leave late at night) and the immediate response was itâ€™s $30 per hour and they would not recommend it. I asked if there was a room or shower we can use to freshen up and get changed before we leave, I was told we could pay for another night. We are welcome to use the outdoor shower by the hotel pool, which is not really practical, and we can use the disabled toilets to get changed. Some other really simple things to fix, offer to take guests luggage to their rooms (our room is approx. 250m from reception). I cannot remember the last time I stayed at a hotel and there was no complimentary water and/or a bottle and a note asking guests to refill from the tap. The staff are friendly and pleasant when you ask about this, however, they seem to have accepted that the standard is what is and they cannot help. Has this ruined our holiday? Absolutely not. Itâ€™s the little things that make the difference though, and my perception is that they have given up at the vibe hotel so I will avoid the chain in future.
showerReviews.author: Julian Court

showerReviews.reviewText:
The vibe Darwin is located right on the waterfront next to the wave pool and the bouncy castle on the water, making it a perfect place to swim safely in Darwin. Our room was extremely clean, the staff were so friendly and helpful.

The real feature of this hotel is the top notch breakfast, which had an enormous selection of food including a robot pancake machine. With food in Australia being so pricey the included breakfast was a huge bonus.

If I were to brave the fearsome humidity of Darwin I would absolutely choose this hotel again. I will say that the charge for laundry seemed a bit excessive , each wash and dry load cost 4 bucks and we had to do the dryer twice so a single load of laundry was 12 dollars plus three for detergent.
showerReviews.author: Ruthless M

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed at vibe the past two nights . Location is awesome . The room was basic , not a balcony room . We rearranged the furniture to at least enjoy the view . We chased the trolley down to be able to at least have clean dry towels . The drying hooks on the bathroom door were not even able to hold a towel . Subsequently our bins were not changed . Donâ€™t expect any room cleaning at all ! Staff seemed to be quite ambivalent to normal requests . No hanging signs for you door ( do not disturb) . Shower was in the bath tub . Parking is an extra 20 bucks a day if you can fit in the car park height wise . Wouldnâ€™t normally complain about these things but when you pay a premium you expect a premium service . At least having the room serviced .

locations.title: bp Truckstop

showerReviews.reviewText: Well what more can you expect! Ahahahah it's brand new, features a 24 hour cafe for those that seek convenience and relaxation before on you go on your  journey. From the new digs, expect a new and clean toilet area (from pics), showers , washing facilities and a trucker's lounge. At the trucker's lounge you can find a smart tv, some chill couches and a quiet area if you need peace. In the main area there is rather a large area for you to sit and relax whilst eating. Expect to find USB ports and PowerPoints for recharging your devices (which I found quite handy). Of course there is no wifi (for those that are data savvy), so make sure to bring your phone or hotspot device. Washing and drying are $4.00 to use, and in addition to the showers you will have to ask for a key at the front counter(couldn't get in as it was locked hence no photos) . The cafe is full of hot and fresh food from the Bain Maree, or you can order fresh from the menu. Prices are reasonable considering the 24 hour opening times, (see pics). There is a variety of food and drinks to chose from, so your really covered (as well as the typical servo stock). Coffee is a hot and miss with this place pending on who is making it. However the food is quite nice and tasty (for a servo), and it's rather a premium upgrade from those that order servo food. I recommend giving it a go and trying it out. The place of course is nice with working aircon, also the large smartscreen tv in the trucker's lounge is great for sports or news. Now about the Feul, considering the bowsers, they are new and fill up a tad quicker than most. I haven't done the bottle test, however the Feul does look extremely clean, and I haven't had an issue with the use in my car or motorbike. Prices are reasonable (you will notice). The staff are friendly and local (with occasional unistudents, or international people) so you know you can have a good yarn about your travel adventures (or life lol). Apart from that I found the place nice to relax , sit-down and eat, and rather clean, they still haven't got the newspapers (I'm old fashioned) however they do have a variety of magazines. There are different types of healthy food and sandwiches (you can see). I recommend the chips with gravy, it's rather a light touch! (Or ask for it fresh). Enjoy :)
showerReviews.author: David Creeper

showerReviews.reviewText:
Service and food have gone to the bin, don't bother.

My husband and myself stopped here for dinner, we waited for 30 minutes for food that was definitely not the standard that was expected and previously experienced. The person in the kitchen attempted to blame the poor quality of food on the "fact" that it, apparently, takes 3 hours to steam vegetables. They normally serve a meal in a large takeaway box. Tonight was leftover meat and frozen peas and corn in a large Chinese container. The person in the kitchen also tried to claim that the kitchen normally would close between 6pm-7pm (at a 24hour truck stop!? Please!) and that meals served after then as always this way, I have never been to this location before 8pm, so I know that is a lie as well. Really disappointing service and food. Plenty of other places around town that people can shower and get food at that is way better than this and at least those places get cleaned, dining area here was a mess when we arrived and still had not changed by the time we left. Apparently, none of the 4 staff know how to clean tables. Don't waste your time or money here, it's not worth it.
showerReviews.author: Nichola Craven

Great place to stop for a feed and shower when on the road!!!
Made to order food is really good, would not eat food thats been sitting out again. eg: lasagne/ chicken and chips. The lasagne was really really dry with the top and bottom sheets of pasta like a rock!  The temp will be luke warm even after they re heat!  the customer service was great!

showerReviews.reviewText: Good new facility with a huge area for truck parking.  Good truckies lounge area with TV.  Clean throughout.  Food was just average but reasonably priced.  One area for improvement is the showers.  Frustrating to see all of this money spent on new facilties that are poorly designed.  The shower cubicles are spacious with a toilet, however there is no door on the shower recess and the water runs into the centre of the room so there is no where dry to stand when you've finished showering and Tring to get dressed
showerReviews.author: Peter C

locations.title: Robin Falls Rest Area

showerReviews.reviewText:
A fun overnight stay at Robin Falls. Lovely experience to be surrounded by the bushland with creek running through and refreshing for a paddle. A walk to the falls early morn my partner did and loved his shower under the waterfall.
Stayed on other side of road to river in one of the bigger expanse areas to camp. There were 3 vans in that space and was great.
Highly recommend for the experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This spot is incredible. Plenty of spots, ok including for big caravans (ours is 23ft and we squeezed it in meters from a nice pool).

We were surprised to find other campers (mid November), but once we explored the place, it became clear why. The waterfall still flowing pretty strong, loads of spots for swimming, lots of shade. Bins provided. A shame that there's still plenty of rubbish lying around, despite the bins.
showerReviews.author: Mindaugas Tijusas

showerReviews.reviewText: Great free camp. Plenty of room, get in early for a nice spot by the creek. Great spot to cool down in the warm afternoon. Relatively easy walk to waterfall. 1 km some rock climbing but our 3yo loved it. Lots of bins but no amenities.
showerReviews.author: Amy Flynn

showerReviews.reviewText: Great free camp. Plenty of room, get in early for a nice spot by the creek. Great spot to cool down in the warm afternoon. Relatively easy walk to waterfall. 1 km some rock climbing but our 3yo loved it. Lots of bins but no amenities.
showerReviews.author: Amy Flynn

showerReviews.reviewText:
This camping spot is quite remote. But having said that itâ€™s actually not too far from the Stuart Highway. There is enough camping areas for 5 to 7 vans, although the further you go down the track, the rougher the road gets.
From the end of the track the walk to the falls is approximately 500 metres over a rocky path. 3/4 of the way in, you have to step over the stream to keep going so I would presume that after rain, the rocky track in would be impassable.
Upon reaching the end, the falls has two drops. One to an upper pool, then to a lower pool which was quite shallow.  The upper pool was accessible as I did see people swimming there, although I did not climb the rocks to view it my self. I visited this site on the 17th of May 2019.
showerReviews.author: Great Australian Adventure

locations.title: Crowne Plaza Alice Springs Lasseters by IHG
locations.address: îƒˆ93 Barrett Dr, Alice Springs NT 0870

showerReviews.reviewText:
Natalie and the front desk crew go above and beyond. They helped us with a shower and luggage after check out even while assisting a large group check in from US. They also provided advice on local restaurants and navigating the town safely.

Would be great if the courtesy bus ran every hour however it's not such a long walk to town of you're willing and mobile. It's actually a lovely walk in with all the huge red gum trees lining the dry creek bed.

Pool was refreshing and even jumped in the spa once it got dark. Rooms were comfortable though bathroom is dated. Sheets were changed and rooms were made up as required.

Not sure on value as booked as part of 16 day trip.

The breakfast omelette was really tasty. Pulled pork sandwich was basic without much pork. Espresso included in breakfast was absolutely awful. Literally spat it back into the cup.
showerReviews.author: Trudy Young

locations.title: Discovery Parks - Alice Springs

showerReviews.reviewText: Spent a few days in Discovery Parks - Alice Springs great park for Cabins, Camping and Campervans. We had a cabin for a few days and a space for our campervan for a few days.  Cabins are very nice, clean, comfortable and fully equipped which was perfect for us during our visit before collecting the campervan. The campervan spaces and facilities were exceptional, the site is very quite, very clean, showers hot, kitchen facilities excellent (all kept very clean, not full of dirt, mud and hairs, the grounds staff deserve applause for their dedication) there is a dump point on site too, and the pool is great for adults and kids alike. The staff in the office are to be commended for their great approach, politeness, patience and overall customer service.  Highly recommended if you need a great place to stay during your visit to Alice Springs.
showerReviews.author: Jason Brown

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked in for a night with plans to head out the following day to seek a free site, but were so impressed that we booked in for the week. Prices are very reasonable, heaps of amenities, helpful staff, safe and quiet location. Yeah, a couple of potholes, but the pools (yes, 4) were clear and clean, unlike another nearby park we stayed at, for nearly triple the price. Alice Springs has lots to see and do, and staying here whilst doing has been a pleasure.
showerReviews.author: Ted Strome

What a cracker spot!
Well located in what seems a safer part of town, heaps and I mean heaps of facilities, lost count of the camp kitchens and amenities. Several different pools, a cool water slide, a totally separate water park area also with a water slide, 2 x bouncy pillows, a lovely hill to watch the sunset, activities every evening.
All of the above coupled with great service and second to none response to any issues going on.
Saw people from the park working well into the night to solve a plumbing issue, minutes after it was reported.
Incredible value for what you get!
Highly recommend this place for so many reasons!
showerReviews.author: Jorge Arriagada

locations.title: Heritage Caravan Park - Pet Friendly
locations.address: îƒˆ40 Ragonesi Rd, Alice Springs NT 0870

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed here three nights. Lovely quiet caravan park. We got a powered site. It was clean and tidy.
Quite close to the town - about a 10 minute drive. And very close to the Alice Springs Brewing Co - eat in or take away. Their pizzas are great!
The amenities block is a bit dated but it was very clean, with really hot showers. This is also a dog friendly park so it was nice to see the dogs as well.
The owners are doing their very best to get the park updated.
The community kitchen had electric jugs, microwave, toasters, BBQ and lots of chairs and tables - they even have a large screen TV on the wall.
Contrary to another reviewer's comment about there being no dump point, I'd like to state that there is a dump point near the amenity block!
They have a pool - we didn't see anyone using it, as well as playground equipment for the kids.
A lovely relaxing couple of days - thank you!
showerReviews.author: NL

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a great caravan stay at Heritage with Jason and his family of staff. Advised heâ€™s only recently taken back over after a long journey with previous management and he, his father and the rest of the team doing a power of work to get things up to speed.

Facilities were a little run down but as I said they are truly pushing out the work to get it up and going. One of the best showers Iâ€™ve had I. 7 weeks!!!.

The team dog sat out two dogs Juni and Marley for portions of 3 days and with plenty of kennels out back Iâ€™m sure would be more than willing to do so for others.  This is how the business was originally built on dog friendly principles.

Dogs wash was great again needs tweaking to fully get back up and running and with a great free time area for the dogs I canâ€™t talk more highly of this place if you have dogs.

Time will be the making of it and given they have only had it back for a few weeks it should be a great park once again.

Thanks again and look forward to returning in the future.

Best wishes Stuart, Eve, Juni and Marley ðŸ˜Š

showerReviews.reviewText: Ajoins a busy pub frequented by locals. Campground, next to a busy road, is ok but the amenities, although new, need a damn good clean and some TLC. Booked online using credit card only to be told I had to pay again as they don't take the money out during online booking. Why the heck take my credit card details then! Wouldn't stay again.
showerReviews.author: Jason

showerReviews.author: Jason

showerReviews.reviewText:
We just stayed at this campsite over the last few nights. We booked based on what we saw online, without having checked it out first. The plus side in our opinion, is that the campsite is attached to the pub, which may not suit everyone. We liked the pub and had a great meal there. In the summer it would be great with the outside area and the pools. It was too cold for us this time unfortunately. This would encourage us to at least stop in again in the summer.
As for the campground, this was a basic unsheltered mostly patch of dirt. The unpowered sites were cheap so we weren't too fussed about the looks of the place. Unfortunately there was no handy camp kitchen. The BBQ areas only had cold water for dishes and you had to pay to use the BBQS. We hadn't seen that at a paid site before. We usually expect at least a free camp kitchen. We did put our money in on one night to do steaks but it turned off well before our food was cooked and we ended up cooking in our van in the end. A waste of money and effort! We don't even like our steaks cooked for long! As for the toilets and showers. It looks at though they were installed within the last few years and that was probably the last clean they had. This area was depressing and filthy. I noticed cleaning equipment sitting outside the block a few times but maybe they were put there by staff who were pretending to management that they had cleaned. When we arrived I had a look into the cubicles and they were horrendous! Every day I had another look to check if things had been cleaned and NO. Before we left, I was so used to seeing this sight that I could describe the mess in detail and was 100% sure nothing had been cleaned. So in general, it was a dirty and depressing place to stay with the only real benefit being the close proximity of the pub. Also, the security gates around the campsite never seemed to be locked at night and we had one of our camping neighbours shooing people away from going through people's things by their vehicles. NOT really safe either!! We're on the road a LOT and this is one of the worst campsites we've come across unfortunately.
showerReviews.author: Kym Robey

showerReviews.reviewText:
Amazing value for money!
$20 for an unpowered site (for the whole group) and there are benches, bbqs (pay $1 for 20 mins) and running water. The shower and toilets block are pristine and brand new - we havenâ€™t seen so many showers in a campground in all our time travelling!
The campground also backs on to the Gap Hotel which is an amazing little pub with a huge outdoor area and pool which you can use - such a rare find and definitely great value for money. Food in the pub is good too, would definitely recommend staying here while in Alice Springs!
showerReviews.author: Ella Duffy

locations.title: Wanngardi Caravan Park
locations.address: îƒˆWanngardi Cvan Pk, 915 Ilparpa Rd, White Gums NT 0870

showerReviews.reviewText:
I write this review after a sound, relaxing, peaceful sleep in what felt like the wilderness. How this place is only 10-15min drive from the center of town is beyond understanding.
When calling requiring an unplanned visit as plans had changed. Josh promptly answered, was beyond accommodating, friendly and informative many hours prior to check in.
Power and Water hook up the best yet, for both pressure, taste and ease - having traveled from Melbourne staying with the regular big named parks I now know my expectations of these bigger more expensive parks needs some adjustment.

Honestly the hottest shower Iâ€™ve had in over a week, clean, a camp kitchen with everything you â€œneedâ€, environmentally friendly sustainable products used in the bathroom facilities as well as a recycling station.
If waking up surrounded by nature, with breathtaking views and tranquility is the experience youâ€™re seeking this is the place for you.
Josh and his family are fair dinkâ€˜em top people. If you wish to have a fire, wood and even a fire pit can be supplied.
We had a great time and will be back if ever passing through again.
Travelling with teenagers and a young child not once did we feel unsafe.
We even unhooked to go into town!
Thank you so much for having us!

The camel rides are across the road, which was another bonus of our trip seen as our planned Uluru rides were cancelled.
Highly recommend coming here to stay if wanting to do the camel rides.
showerReviews.author: Joanne JP

Highly recommend coming here to stay if wanting to do the camel rides.
showerReviews.author: Joanne JP

showerReviews.reviewText: Such a lovely, spacious, peaceful campground. Helpful and friendly hosts, best recycling system I have ever seen, clean , homely bathrooms and a good camp kitchen. Loved our 3 nights staying here.

If your the self sufficient type this park is ideal for a caravan or trailer being not to close to Alice but within 15minutes  ..
I like the recycling station they have set up for glass plastics cans compost. And ordinary rubbish great idea you don't see that often ...well run casual park 4stars..

locations.title: Blatherskite Park

showerReviews.reviewText:
Our 2 nights stay was really disappointing!The site we were given was very close to the sewerage treatment works and the smell was herendous and really overpowering!
The bathrooms and laundry ( washing machine cost $8 per load!) were not clean and were obviously not cleaned during our stay.
The 2 stars are given for the green space and ease of parking a van.
We stayed here a couple of years ago and enjoyed our stay, however we will definitely not be staying here again.
showerReviews.author: Susan Virtue

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. Booked in for 4 nights and stayed 3 weeks. Amenities are older but were cleaned regularly and everything worked. We moved sites midway through our stay due to the Rodeo being on. First camp was near the dog shelter and yes you can hear the dogs throughout the day but not a major problem. If it is a concern then ask to stay on the otherside of the park. Our second site towards the treatment work and was fine. Occasional smell if the wind is howling but again, not a problem. Only negative was the grass was long and seeding on that side of the park. The Showground is a massive area to maintain but would suggest if the sites are being rented out then they need to be maintained. We will stay again when we are next in Alice
showerReviews.author: JASON WILLIAMS

showerReviews.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. Booked in for 4 nights and stayed 3 weeks. Amenities are older but were cleaned regularly and everything worked. showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Blatherskite Park Campground in Alice Springs and we can say that thereâ€™s a lot to be said about staying here as opposed to a caravan park - itâ€™s way better!
Helen, the Office Manager handling the Parkâ€™s reservations at Blatherskite Park Campground is a lovely lady.  She was very friendly and helpful over the phone and unbelievably thorough and totally organised when she made our booking.  But unfortunately, shortly after our booking was made, we caused disruption to our booking dates by having to check in earlier than expected.  A major fault had occurred when travelling with our caravan.  We were worried that we wouldnâ€™t make it into Alice Springs.  We had to get there urgently as we needed to get the caravan repaired so we could get it up and running and be on our way.  Helen was just fantastic in fitting us in and accommodating us earlier than our expected arrival date and at such short notice.  Thank you so much Helen, we appreciate it.  Our thanks also go out to the Caretaker who phoned through our situation to Helen.  Although it was very late in the day, he then permitted us to enter the Park and allowed us to gain access through the gate.
Blatherskite Park Campground offers very affordable grassy and spacious powered and unpowered sites.  You are not camped on top of each other here unlike that of a certain caravan park where we once regrettably stayed in Alice Springs. It is very quiet too, being just out of town - you get to relax here and thatâ€™s got to be well worth it.
The amenities, though dated, are very clean and well maintained and the showers are always lovely and hot.
There are skips located in the Park Campground for your rubbish and the grounds are well maintained and mowed regularly and itâ€™s all quite neat and tidy.
No negatives at all.  In fact we loved it here.  Great value for money with perfect hosts offering fantastic service.  What more could you want?  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.  If and when we return to Alice Springs, this is where we will be staying.  Thank you all at Blatherskite Park - we really appreciate what you do!
showerReviews.author: Keith & Anne

showerReviews.reviewText: We booked for 3 nights and ended up extending our stay to just over two weeks. Helen was fabulous at organising the sites so that we were all spread out and not on top of to eachother like at caravan parks. This was great because we have dogs and it meant that they weren't distracted by other campers right next door. She also suggested areas for us to let our dogs run. It was such a nice change to have big trees for shade and grass under our feet. The showgrounds are a bit of a community hub and it was lovely to sew people ride their horses around the park and oval. The sunsets are fabulous at the showgrounds and the drive in and out of town is also beautiful as you cut through the large rockfaces. On the very last day we saw an emu just over the fence of the showgrounds which was pretty exciting! All the amenities were in good working order and kept clean. The whole place felt relaxing and fuss free. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and loved seeing all the horses!
showerReviews.author: Olivia Reddan

showerReviews.reviewText:
A beautiful scenic park with a very relaxed vibe. Owners are so helpful. We stayed 3 nights and got all our washing done in the well maintained laundry. Fantastic relaxing camping experience away from the hustle and bustle yet 15 min drive to town. Toilets and showers are clean but slightly small in showers though plenty of hot water we really didnâ€™t care too much about the size.
It doesnâ€™t have all the bells and whistles but suited us and our 2 dogs perfectly. We would definitely stay here again. Thanks Trish for a delightful experience.

Thanks for having us Trish,
Cheers Paul & Helen

We had a chance to restock, wash up, clean up and refresh after doing Outback Way.

locations.address: îƒˆOrmiston Gorge Access, Mount Zeil NT 0872

showerReviews.reviewText: Ormiston Gorge Campsite is basic with no hook-ups, and the facilities are a bit â€œmeh,â€ but I was pleasantly surprised by the warm showers and warm water for washing up. Good BBQ area, and itâ€™s only a short walk to the gorge itself for a swim. Water levels were low during our visit, but we still had a fun time. Iâ€™ve seen better campgrounds, but this was a solid stay.
showerReviews.author: Chris Roylance

showerReviews.reviewText: A beautiful place.  Our only complaint was the smell coming from the septic. It was so bad that one lot of campers moved to a site further away.  Facilities are basic with 2 toilets (including a disabled) and 1 shower.  No rubbish collection but a complicated recycling system with several bins all for different things. The staff were very friendly.  The campground is fine for a central base while exploring the Western MacDonnell's and is a lot more affordable than the alternative at Glen Helen.
showerReviews.author: Kerrie Damen

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely camp ground out in the National Park- book ahead as less than 20 non-powered sites. Facilities are fair - undercover electric bbqs,  a few usb charging ports, toilets with hot showers. Toilet block is a bit rustic.

50m walk to kiosk when open for coffee & meals. Also sells various indigenous art items. Start of various walks from 10min to water hole, 30min uphill to gorge lookout or 3-4hr Poubd walk  also on Larapibta Teail

Wed 3pm Ranger led walk for 1hr - good coverage on landscape & ecology. Takes you to lookout.
showerReviews.author: Peter E

Sites very sloping - bring chocks & ramps & extra height blocks for your jockey wheel! We had site 15 and nearly didnâ€™t stay - ended up with rocks under the jockey wheel to try to get it even. Rocks to wheels as well - happy we only had one night wouldnâ€™t have stayed another. A RV came into 19 late and ended up leaving as it was too slopy.
The George is beautiful & the walks lovely - 2 toilets only - Ellery Gorge had 4 toilets for less sites. Didnâ€™t use shower as looked very dirty. Personally I wouldnâ€™t be back.

locations.title: Camping @ National Road Transport museum
locations.address: îƒˆ2 Norris Bell Ave, Arumbera NT 0873

showerReviews.reviewText: A great display of our national transport. Very much focused on trucks and the hero's and characters of the industry dating back to very early days. The Ghan rail history is very well presented as well with walk through carriages and historical photos. Camping in the rear is very affordable with very old but clean amenities  (they do need a fair bit of maintenance but they work).
showerReviews.author: Chris Hooper

locations.title: Arltunga Bush Pub & Eco Retreat

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brad and Belinda are amazing hosts, and are very knowledgeable of the area. The glamping tents are very comfortable and has everything and more for your stay. The drive from Alice Springs to Arltunga is full of amazing views. Lots of places to visit and explore in the East Macdonnell Ranges. And the beers are cold and enjoyable at the end of a day of exploring!
Highly recommend, plenty of space at the camp ground, swimming pool and maintained facilities.
showerReviews.author: Diana

showerReviews.reviewText:
Brad and Belinda are amazing hosts, and are very knowledgeable of the area. The glamping tents are very comfortable and has everything and more for your stay. The drive from Alice Springs to Arltunga is full of amazing views. Lots of places to visit and explore in the East Macdonnell Ranges. And the beers are cold and enjoyable at the end of a day of exploring!
Highly recommend, plenty of space at the camp ground, swimming pool and maintained facilities.
showerReviews.author: Diana

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a wonderful experience- thanks to the exuberance of Brad, and the delightful Belinda.
Pizza night, and we thought not again just having had a couple of pizza nights in Alice- well these rocked the socks off Alice's pizzas. Would go back for them in a heart beat. And the same with the freaking awesome burgers we had for lunch = forced us into a wine and cheese evening + finishing with a cuppa soup, when we got back to Alice.
The bathrooms were sensational- FOUR pegs in each to hang stuff + wooden floor mat, oh and a loo included. Plenty of camping space, though lucky us, had the ones camp beside us where I could touch both campers arms outstretched - too close buddy for bush camping! A camp kitchen, not checked out, as we were too busy eating in the pub!
showerReviews.author: Sheena Shepherd

showerReviews.reviewText:
We traveled here from Alice, we rung ahead and had really helpful information from the owners about the road.
It's a stunning drive!
6 of us had a lovely lunch here - they are still working on parts of the campground (think it's great now but will be awesome when finished) the pub is looking great and has nice clean amenities.

A great little spot to eat and drink before or after exploring the walks and ruins in old Arltunga.

showerReviews.reviewText: This currently is a work in progress. The pub is being rebuilt but the campground is open and functional. We had a very quiet and comfortable night. The amenities are good - flush toilets in the large shower rooms with basins. There is a camp kitchen with a fridge. The owner is super friendly and helpful. We had a very good experience and would be curious to see it once the pub is finished and the swimming pool installed.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic place to stay, hosts Belinda and Brad are very welcoming with great knowledge of the area to assist with your touring. They have put in a lot of work renovating the pub and camp ground amenities which are kept very clean. You can also hire a dog box to put your dog in for the day to enable you to visit the National Park.
Great job Belinda and Brad and all the best for your future endeavours.
John, Jeannie, Red and Benny.
showerReviews.author: John Palmer

showerReviews.reviewText: We had the best ever outback experience here. Brad and Belinda are so very welcoming. The road in was a touch bumpy but well worth it in the end. We highly recommend visiting and staying in the caravan park. Amenities were clean and well organised.
showerReviews.author: Rhonda Williams

showerReviews.reviewText: We had the best ever outback experience here. Brad and Belinda are so very welcoming. The road in was a touch bumpy but well worth it in the end. We highly recommend visiting and staying in the caravan park. Amenities were clean and well organised.
showerReviews.author: Rhonda Williams

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just enjoyed a fantastic stay camping at Arltunga with hosts Brad and Belinda. What a great experience; excellent food, cold drinks, great coffee and warm and responsive service.Great camping facilities including hot showers!
Highly recommend a stay when travelling to the East MacDonnell Ranges.
showerReviews.author: Peter Jahnsen

showerReviews.reviewText:
We have just enjoyed a fantastic stay camping at Arltunga with hosts Brad and Belinda. What a great experience; excellent food, cold drinks, great coffee and warm and responsive service.Great camping facilities including hot showers!
Highly recommend a stay when travelling to the East MacDonnell Ranges.

showerReviews.reviewText: It really is a bonus to have somewhere for a drink and chat around the fire. Owners keep the meal offerings simple which works well, camping area has modern amenities and there is even a pool with warmer section and ambient. All up a great 5 night stay to explore the area
showerReviews.author: Steve Armitage

showerReviews.reviewText: It really is a bonus to have somewhere for a drink and chat around the fire. Owners keep the meal offerings simple which works well, camping area has modern amenities and there is even a pool with warmer section and ambient. All up a great 5 night stay to explore the area

showerReviews.reviewText: This would be the best stopping place in the East McDonnell Ranges. Fabulous camp-sites which are close to pub with pool, fantastic shower and toilets, and what a great pub. Best pizza's and great atmosphere. And such friendly    owners. We will be back.
showerReviews.author: Ross Boreham

showerReviews.reviewText: This would be the best stopping place in the East McDonnell Ranges. Fabulous camp-sites which are close to pub with pool, fantastic shower and toilets, and what a great pub. Best pizza's and great atmosphere. And such friendly    owners. We will be back.
showerReviews.author: Ross Boreham

locations.title: Palm Valley Campground

showerReviews.reviewText: Basic but well kept facilities, very welcome to be able to have a shower. Small sites close together but the crowd were well behaved when I visited.
showerReviews.author: Graham Woodland

showerReviews.reviewText: Basic but well kept facilities, very welcome to be able to have a shower. Small sites close together but the crowd were well behaved when I visited.
showerReviews.author: Graham Woodland

showerReviews.reviewText: This place was one of the highlights of our trip. Paid for 1 night, then decided to stay 2nights. Once we arrived. Has toilets and supposed to have hot showers. Unfortunately the showers were out of order (which was fine), just a shame that we paid extra for supposedly having accessibility to hot showers compared to other campgrounds in the region. None the less, it was still a great place. Plenty to do and see and the wildlife was of abundance too. The ranger came around on one of the days and gave all of us campers an informative show and tell about the national park and of it's fauna and flora.
showerReviews.author: Kylie S

showerReviews.reviewText: This place was one of the highlights of our trip. Paid for 1 night, then decided to stay 2nights. Once we arrived. Has toilets and supposed to have hot showers.
