showerReviews.reviewText:
Probably the best place for our outback tour. Toilet and shower clean with hot water ( I guess the heating is solar, so nothing is guaranteed) .
Magnificent landscape and beautiful campsite. Breakfast on the grass by the river... Many activities possible, but the most wonderful was the change in colour of the rocks throughout the day.
Our planning was tight so we stayed only 1 night, but I recommend 2 days to make the most of this wonderful place.
Access may be difficult or not possible in case of heavy rain. Must contact the rangers in case of doubt.
showerReviews.author: Roger Magic

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: Nice camping, nice toilets and hot showers, Yes you need a 4WD to get in too but worth it, good site for caravan 6,8,10,14,16,17,18,19

showerReviews.reviewText:
Relatively remote campground is a must do if you're going into Palm Valley. About half an hour on a 4WD track off the highway. Some sandy and rocky patches but mostly flat. Firewood can be collect right up to the national park entrance.

Campground has a toilet block with showers though on our visit showers were out of action. Communal fire spot in middle or camp. Great dark skies. Can hear dingos at night.
showerReviews.author: Dylan Schumacher

showerReviews.reviewText:
Relatively remote campground is a must do if you're going into Palm Valley. About half an hour on a 4WD track off the highway. Some sandy and rocky patches but mostly flat. Firewood can be collect right up to the national park entrance.

Campground has a toilet block with showers though on our visit showers were out of action. Communal fire spot in middle or camp. Great dark skies. Can hear dingos at night.

showerReviews.reviewText: Good campground. With toilets and showers (hot even in late evening). You can hear dingos howling or see them if you are lucky. No phone service. Surrended by open nature. Road from Hermannsburg/ Ntaria to the Campground through the riverbed of the Finke River - 4WD only! Lot of sand dunes, gravel and rocks. Road from Campground to the parking lot near Palm Valley very challenging!! Bare rocks, loose sand and big surface differences. Be well prepared! Otherwise very nice place with great atmosphere.
showerReviews.author: Lada LipkovÃ¡

showerReviews.reviewText:
Clean bathroom with hot showers
Nice large clear sites
A short walk to the 12 mile yards and boat ramp.
Must book site online

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great volunteers keeping an eye on the place and touching base with people in the evening to make sure everyone's alright and in the right spot.

Hot showers with decent pressure. The rest of the amenities were tidy and clean. There was even a spot to do the dishes on the side of the toilet block which was a little bonus

Good spot and would come back if in the area

showerReviews.reviewText: Great camping spot, large sites not on top of each other like some. Hot shower was fantastic.
showerReviews.author: Peter Pullen.

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely campground, which includes hot showers, flushing toilets and a washing up area. Lots of natural shade with trees throughout. We were surprised how quiet it was given its peak season right now. Each camp site is very spacious and the ground is nice and soft, so good for tents and swags.
showerReviews.author: Georgy Elle

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely campground, which includes hot showers, flushing toilets and a washing up area. Lots of natural shade with trees throughout. We were surprised how quiet it was given its peak season right now. Each camp site is very spacious and the ground is nice and soft, so good for tents and swags.
showerReviews.author: Georgy Elle

showerReviews.reviewText: BOOK ONLINE FIRST, then visit this lush & spacious campground. Iâ€™ve seen people in the reviews complain about size but each spot seems to be large enough for a caravan & the spots arenâ€™t sitting on top of one another, for the most part. This place is huge! Luckily weâ€™re off grid as we had â€˜Overflow 2â€™ camp spot & it was quite a walk to the toilets/showers. There are single or shared fire pits at most sites & there are shared BBQs at the toilet blocks, with picnic tables & chairs, surrounded by cyclone fencing, no doubt to keep the wildlife away from your food. Sprinklers keep campsite grass luscious for our enjoyment. Host Anne greeted us upon our arrival, & thank goodness, because itâ€™s easy to get lost in here. Do yourself a favour & take a photo of the map upon entry to help. NOTE: Host resides at site 39 if you need help. What you read about the online booking system is true. When we got here, Anne said our campsite didnâ€™t exist & found a spot to fit our car & caravan, however, had to do the same again that evening for someone else who was booked where weâ€™d been put. Anne was with Optus & was able to get clarification on campsite bookings the following day. She also arranged for additional nights as we are with Telstra & no service here. If you walk outside of the campsite towards Roper River youâ€™ll find plenty of walking tracks & fishing spots, but itâ€™s a bit rocky & some climbing is needed. Thereâ€™s a boat ramp near 12 Mile Yards Day Use Area along with more hiking trails through to Mularark, Mataranka Falls & 4 Mile. There are signs to hike all the way through the bushland, along the river, but away from the riverbank, all the way down John Hauser Drive. There is no laundromat in town but the local caravan park agreed for us to use their facilities. BRING PLENTY OF FOOD! Especially if you have certain requirements. The supermarket shelves were quite bare & being so rural probably donâ€™t stock up often. Plenty of frozen meat of small portions & 150-200% of a city price. Locals were friendly when we were wandering around town during the day. Host Anne told us we could use the taps at the toilet blocks for drinking water as itâ€™s filtered river water & she claims â€œitâ€™s great!â€. As of 5 July 2023 the council dump point was closed noted "out of service" with no other information. Advised by the caravan park that the closest dump points are Larrimah NT (48 minutes 76km) or Katherine NT (1 hour 9 minutes or 108km). C U in the N T! ;)
showerReviews.author: K Cro

showerReviews.reviewText: Jalmurark Campsite on the Roper River is a brilliant  campsite. Well laid out, no dust due to bitumen access. Great hot showers, gas bbqs and a brilliant Grade 2 walk along the river to Mataranka Falls. Very quiet, great feeling about the place. Close to other things to see and do like Bitter Springs.
showerReviews.author: Andrew Rose

showerReviews.reviewText: I had this campground booked weeks in advance #site32 requested leave from work and was so excited about my trip coming from Darwin. First night was good ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ next day I went on the mataranka falls hike.. which was good also ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ on my return to camp...EVERYTHING was saturated wet, I was camping in a tent. My whole camp looked like it had just been dumped in the river.. my swag and bedding was floating in a pool of water. The host had forgotten to take out the sprinkler which was in the ground and the ranger turned them in while I was hiking. Nothing was salvageable without at least 48hours of drying time. I had to pack up my camp.. soaking wet into my car and tried to get accommodation in mataranka, as it is the dry season EVERYWHERE was booked out so I drove to Katherine where I was met with the same thing except for 1 room available at the cost of $285 and was definitely not the hilton. I then tried pine creek, same situation. I had to drive back to Darwin, arrived home 10.45 that night. Spent the next 2days of my leave washing, drying and airing out camp gear and my car ðŸ¤¬ not a happy camper. So I leave you all with a very good tip if your to stay at this campground, please ask the host to take out the sprinkler as is their job for staying there. Happy travels people ðŸŒˆðŸ¦‹ðŸŒˆðŸŒˆðŸ¦‹ðŸ¦‹ðŸ•ï¸

locations.title: Ayers Rock Campground

showerReviews.reviewText: The campground itself isnâ€™t too bad, but for the price (70$ per night for a powered site) I expected much more. The pool was very dirty, and the washing machines didnâ€™t work â€” I tried two of them and neither worked; I only managed to do my laundry on the third attempt. On top of that, the garbage truck comes by at 6 a.m., waking everyone up. I understand itâ€™s the only campground in the area so they can get away with it, but overall I was quite disappointed.
showerReviews.author: sofia castrogiovanni

showerReviews.reviewText:
The entire Ayers Rock resort complex at Yulara is fantastic! We stayed in the campground - toilets and showers were plentiful and clean. Only disappointment is that we booked an extra large unpowered site thinking we would have a bit of extra space between the neighbouring sites, but it was super narrow, just long. We couldn't even put the awning out on our camper, which was much needed in the intense heat. So just be aware that extra large doesn't mean wider, just longer. Having said that, there are lots of trees so we were able to find shade during the day.
The pool was a lovely relief from the heat of the day. Lots of bins and recycling. Short drive to Uluru.
showerReviews.author: Lara

showerReviews.reviewText:

locations.title: Alice's Secret Travellers Inn
locations.address: îƒˆ6 Khalick St, East Side NT 0870

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quirky and cheap were definitely the 2 best things about it. We stayed here for two nights and enjoyed the strong, hot showers. There's a lot of communal, cosy features, like the Book Room, free food in the kitchen, shared games, decently-sized kitchen, tea/coffee, etc. We stayed in the caravan which got quite cold at night, would be great if it had warmer blankets/heavier donnas (acrylic blankets do not help...). The heater helped but for sustainability, don't want to leave it on all night! Not at lot of space for luggage so it helped that we could leave things in the car. Beds etc are basic and a bit worn but there's obviously a lot of love and fun put into the set-up of different rooms, the bus, etc and it's pretty fair for the price of a hostel in Australia.
The car park requires some creativity, communication and logistics to manage...The whole hostel is quite secure with both gates having a combination lock. Location is good too.
showerReviews.author: Lola Orange

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is a pitt. Rooms are fine for the price but this is the most disgusting hostel I've stayed at. Showers, toilets and kitchen don't seem to ever be cleaned. Everything is falling to pieces. From the noizy split system to the outdoor tables. No lights outside, disgusting and leaking BBQ, you get the picture...
Extra edit after the lovely message from the owner: you need to chose your line of argument. Either this is so cheap and that's why it's a pitt, or this place is a palace and I'm lying but you can't win on both. You mentioned that we spent 4 days there so you also know we booked at your dump given that I hadn't mention that detail. If other people are OK to live in unclean places, each to their own. But cheap should not equal to dirty. And as said, I did say the rooms are OK so that's why we stayed. But I hope your response will show how much you care about your customers and as per some other comments, that is clearly not customer service that is driving you.
==> All reading this, stay away from this place...
showerReviews.author: Arnaud Charlier

showerReviews.reviewText: About a 10â€“15 min walk from the Greyhound stop and shops. Clean, basic room with a fridge - quiet. Photos are somewhat accurate, maybe a bit more polished than reality. locations.title: Jump Inn Alice Budget Accommodation
locations.address: îƒˆ4 Traeger Ave, The Gap NT 0870

showerReviews.reviewText:
We really enjoyed our short time at Jump Inn, the vibes were really cool. The bar area was a really nice area to wind down and have a few drinks.
The bed was nice and comfy, especially after spending a few days camping in swags. Our room was nice and clean but perhaps a small bedside table would have been useful for personal belongings. One problem we had was that the water from the shower went all over the bathroom, wetting the toilet area as well. A towel rack or hooks would have been useful to hang towels and clothes in the bathroom
Breakfast runs out quickly, so best to get there before 8:00-8:30am if possible.
showerReviews.author: Nimna Amunugama

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very average hotel. Good location and staff were polite, but the rooms and amenities were poor. We stayed twice in one week. The first room had a mouldy bathtub. The second had a face washer with a large hole in it.
The hotel advertises hairdryers in the rooms, but neither of ours had one. The first time staff eventually found one, the second time they couldnâ€™t and suggested moving us to another room after weâ€™d already unpacked.
There were teabags provided but no cutlery, only a couple of glass cups.

locations.title: Healing Sands Therapy Centre
locations.address: îƒˆ6 Achilpa St, The Gap NT 0870

showerReviews.reviewText:
The most incredible post-Larapinta massage I could have hoped for. Juciane made me feel so at ease and in such good hands from the moment I walked in, you can easily tell that every element of the experience has been so carefully considered to leave you feeling the most relaxed, cared for and soothed possible.
She paid special attention to my sore feet, calves and back, with wonderful surprises of hot stones, heat packs, hot towels and an assortment of rejuvenating essential oils. It felt like a totally luxurious experience at what I thought was a very reasonable price point (especially compared to other places in Alice). I absolutely floated out feeling a million times better than I walked in. Just wonderful!
showerReviews.author: Kate Cameron

showerReviews.reviewText:
What a delightful park! Itâ€™s a little out of town which is a good thing - we felt safe. We were gone all day during our two day stay and there were no issues at all.

You can tell there is excellent management here with high standards as the whole park is immaculately presented.

It was busy but there were always showers and toilets available and they were spotlessly clean.

We were tent peasants for this trip and had a lovely shady generous size site 52. Very close to the amenities. There are lots of trees and palms. The front section has some pretty fancy cabins overlooking the new pool.

There are two pools, laundry with dryers and a decent amount of clotheslines, kitchen with sinks, microwave, kettle and gas burner as well as hot plates.  Everything you need.

They also had some activities such as Friday sausage sizzle which was a $2 donation and Sunday the same for pancakes.

The camp was quiet at night - most ppl down for the night by 7-8pm.

Next time we stay at Katherine we will definitely have this as our first option!
showerReviews.author: Audrey

locations.title: Boab Caravan Park
locations.address: îƒˆ42 Victoria Hwy, Katherine South NT 0850

showerReviews.reviewText:
What can I say that is positive about this Caravan Park. Not much, only that the site was good. Right from the start we found the receptionist very rude, unhelpful, and abrupt! She was extremely dogmatic, and was a know all on everything...not!
The amenities were disgusting, and not cleaned or touched in the whole four days that we were there. I placed a piece of paper on the floor on our second day to test my theory, and it was still there two days later!
Also, the front Security Gate did not work, and we were told to slide it open and close by hand. What Security is that, especially when there is no lock mechanism as well. This Park also has NO WiFi, or Dump point as well.
Would definitely NOT recommend this Caravan Park to anyone staying in Katherine. There are plenty of others to choose from!
showerReviews.author: Warren S

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed here for a week, we left there on 10th July.  We got the last site available that they keep for motorhomes, or small campers, on the exit corner, because it's a difficult site to get in with a caravan.
I asked could I see before committing, the manager happily agreed to me even trying with the van before taking my money. Much appreciated too.

I got the van in, so all was good. She even gave me a 7 day discount, even though they normally don't. Saved a few $$$

Great park, great management, very friendly and helpful. Sites are angled for easy exit, and concrete for van and vehicle, and awning, can't ask for better.

Amenities were clean and tidy.
Large camp kitchen, big tv, everything you'd need. Tables and bench seats plentiful.

Would definitely stay again if going through.

Gus and Kerrie Brisbane.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fabulous location.
Fabulously kept grounds. Great clean well kept amenities.We were closer to the main road at front of the park and loved the trees and the ground around that section (just down from the pool).
Lovely staff and helpful.
Loved the pool and enclosed area of the pool to sit and relax on one of the loungers.
If you want the thermal springs you just walk out the van park back gate and its right there.
My partner and I road our bikes in cooler afternoon on the path that runs either side of the springs and thoroughly enjoyed it.
Even had a wallaby or kanga run past us on the bush side while cycling down path.
Thanks all.
showerReviews.author: Sandy Boyd

Staff were really friendly and the amenities were very clean. Also lots of birds about and close to the river which is a nice place to cool down.

The restaurant on site, the big fig, was lovely with a great outdoor setting,  good food and value for money. Shower blocks were very clean with plenty of hot water. Swimming pool is great, quite warm,  shaded area, and fenced so nice and safe for kids. No WiFi on site for us overseas guests but you can piggy back at reception.  Staff on site are very helpful and friendly.  A lovely caravan park.

locations.title: Katherine Club Inc

showerReviews.reviewText:
Decent. Clean. Responsive
Clean facilities and toilets.
Responsive service especially from Skye.

Food was a hit and miss for hubby and I
- Buffalo wings were drenched in oil. So we had to return them.
- Got the kebabs as a replacement which were delicious but some were not well cooked.
- The lamb shank, vegetables and sweet potato mash were lovely.
- Requested for the scotch fillet to be well well done but two attempts and they didn't get it right (see photos). The mash was oily and looked rubbery. So couldn't eat this meal.

All in all because of the hit and miss for the food they scored poorly/averagely.
showerReviews.author: FROM HEAD TO HEELS

locations.title: Pine Tree Motel

showerReviews.reviewText:
Room was a good size. Bed was comfortable. Appeared clean. Shower not good. Bed linen was grey and there were bedbugs which we left with. We were bitten and suffered until we arrived home.
Need to fumigate the rooms, beds mattresses and every nook and cranny of the rooms. Not enough to wash linen in hot water. Pity because the management works hard and breakfast was excellent. The place needs an overhaul.
showerReviews.author: judy kaplan

showerReviews.reviewText:
I'm not sure how this place is called a resort?
The foods great but way over priced for what it is.
The rooms are atroshish, dirty and easily 40 years old. Bed feels about like you're sleeping on bare springs and is easily 30 years old. The towel rail for the bathroom is nailed to a wall next to the bed.
Please note: Cars are often broken into on site, do not leave anything valuable inside it.
Overall very poor and boarderline unsafe! Avoid if you can!

showerReviews.reviewText: Good campground, though the hot water runs out at the showers so be prepared for a cool shower. Most of the sites are quite small so ensure you check the size when you booked. There is plenty of open grassy, shady space to put your chairs â€¦

showerReviews.reviewText:
Edith Falls - great National park campgroud. Relatively clean toilets and showers, grass in most areas, BBQs available, drinking water on hand.
Sites are VERY tight, so make sure you can fit.
A number of people turning up expecting site 3A and 3B to be two sites.  Expect to put your car in one and your van in the other.
Don't be precious about it.... you are charged by the number of poeple, not the number of sites.
This is a well presented campground, next to an outstanding water fall and swimming area.  Good on NT parks!
showerReviews.author: Geoff Wood

showerReviews.reviewText:

showerReviews.reviewText: I love camping at Leliyn Campground and have been doing so for many years. The waterholes are of course stunning and the picnic area has lovely shade. The larger sites are very spacious. However, in recent times the amenities have really, really deteriorated. The toilet blocks are very stinky (under-maintained septic tanks?); showers are often cold, soap runs out. The kiosk doesn't provide any ice (not sure if it ever did, come to think of it, but this would be a really handy service given that the nearest ice is 45mins + away). It would be so lovely if these amenities could be returned to something like their former glory from when the campground was commercially managed. In their current condition they are a hygiene risk and off putting.
showerReviews.author: Rowshni Ahmed

showerReviews.reviewText: Wow what a place! Top location only 2 minutes from the plunge pool. The water is cool which is very welcome in this hot season. The campground is wonderfully designed with mostly big sites and green grass. And the best of all, the water comes from a bore, so every water tap is drinking water! Amenities are good and for that price no one can complain.

showerReviews.reviewText:
This was a good spot to camp however in  saying that, they should have told us 2 buses were turning up full of children. Everyone in the campground was disappointed as no one could use the camp kitchen & they took over the pool area.
The 3 gorge was well worth it & the swim was refreshing. You do need to do a small amount of walking so just comfortable shoes.
They also had everyone a small bag with water, fruit, brownie & a biscuit. They have water to top your water bottle up.

showerReviews.reviewText: This camp is in the perfect situation for the gorge cruises, we stayed 2 nights and could walk easy to where they left from a bonus. The pool area the other bonus well laid out large area good sized pool and a bar for drinks. However the camp let's itself down being the most expensive we have stayed at $60 a night non power site, one would expect the amenities reflect this but no badly in need of some maintenance, kept very clean and staff all very helpful and friendly. Also fencing around very bad condition and lastly probably also on the national park people the growth of a creeper covering all the native bush needs to be brought under control. Kitchen facilities not that great. Camp value should be around $40 non power site taking everything into consideration
showerReviews.author: lynne Cook

The campground is alright, the best being the pool I reckon and the location. The amenities are OK, they could be cleaner. The kitchen has got a fridge, a kettle, a toaster but no stove: that's pretty unusual. The sink from the kitchen can hardly be used for washing up: the flow is so small, no plug and water is cold, not much you can do with that.
Good to be at a walking distance from the Jetty to explore the gorge.

locations.title: Bitter Springs Cabins and Camping

showerReviews.reviewText:
The operators were very helpful and polite. The sites were a generous size also the amenities great.
With an area for cleaning your vehicles was also an added bonus.
They have an on-site caravan repairer which was really helpful to us as we had a couple smaller jobs he was able to assist us with.
They gave us directions to the other hot springs but sadly due to the smell of the bats we didn't go and check it out.
We highly recommend this park if your needing somewhere in Mataranka.
showerReviews.author: David Callaghan

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed in a powered camp-site and used the bathrooms.  Lovely hot showers in separate bathrooms.  Bore water has coloured the concrete but it is well set up - and would be great for a family to use as the toilet, basin and shower are all in a room.  Kitchen was good with hot tap water too - but drains needed unblocking so sinks empty properly.  Kitchen also had a good fridge/freezer you could use.
showerReviews.author: Julie Pearson

showerReviews.reviewText: We stayed in a powered camp-site and used the bathrooms.  Lovely hot showers in separate bathrooms.  Bore water has coloured the concrete but it is well set up - and would be great for a family to use as the toilet, basin and shower are all in a room.  Kitchen was good with hot tap water too - but drains needed unblocking so sinks empty properly.  Kitchen also had a good fridge/freezer you could use.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed for 3 nights on a powered site. Absolutely terrific. Discounted for extra nights. We are FSC, so had no need to use amenities or camp kitchen, so can't comment unfortunately, but if the rest is anything to go by, will be fine. They had a water truck patrolling throughout the day to keep dust down, but to be honest, there wasn't a lot of wind to stir it up anyway. Terrific sites, with plenty of shade around. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
Take a leisurely 8 minute stroll to the Bitter Springs. Life doesn't get much better. The water is warm and clear. Bring a noodle or 2, and just let the current take you to the bridge, get out, walk back and repeat. No cost, just need the parks pass. Didn't see any fish, but there were a number of turtles, so bring goggles and a new world will be opened up to you.
Although fully paved with concrete paths, unfortunately no ramp or easy access for disabled, other than physically lifting in and out of the water.
showerReviews.author: Crian Mackenzie

locations.title: Palm Court Kookaburra Backpackers

showerReviews.reviewText: I booked a room over phone with them.The female I spoke to over the phone was very courteous.  The rooms however were filthy , there were about 50 small cockroaches in front of me and then there was a fridge that was not working which was full of them. The room looked unclean and shabby, with bedsheets being dirty and they were charging 120 bucks for it. They offered me another room but when I checked that one , it was no different either. I complained about it and they refunded my money without dramas, so that part was alright. There is a swimming pool that looks more like a pond with disgusting stale water. This place should not be open as it does not meet the basic hygene standards .Guys please check the rooms before booking.
showerReviews.author: Manny Singh (Maninderjit)

showerReviews.reviewText:
The location is great, close to the shops and main street.  Staff were very friendly and accommodating, which made the stay bearable.  The pool was also refreshing on a hot day.

Unfortunately the room felt old and unmaintained.  The lockers appeared bent and broken, the fridge didn't work, and the aircon and fans were pretty noisy.  The other guests also made us feel a bit uneasy - we discovered in the morning that one had attempted to break into our van, and was later arrested for disorderly conduct.

Coco's Backpackers is a reasonable (if not a little old) alternative for those on a budget.  Otherwise spend a little more for a cabin at Riverview Tourist Park, which, while slightly further from town was far nicer and close to the great Hot Springs.
showerReviews.author: Simon

locations.title: Beagle Hotel

showerReviews.reviewText:
I would like this review to be helpful to the Jawoyn Assoc. The same Assoc that runs the Nitmiluk Gorge Cruises & associated activities in such a professional, safe & seamless manner. The Beagle should be the Motel of choice for anyone who has experienced Nitmiluk. But sadly, it doesn't match that standard.
We had a "Superior Queen" room, which stated it's a comfortable room for two people. We paid over $200 for this.
What was delivered was a room nowhere near Superior.
For two people there was;
1 glass
1 bedside table
1 chair
No bedside lamps
No towel rails or even hooks in the bathroom.
The small electric jug leaked water over the bench.

The lino floor had holes in it. The venetian blind didn't shut properly. The curtains over it were see through (see photos) The light outside was on all night, so our room was bright. Sleep was difficult. And I did not undress or dress in the room as anyone walking past could see into the room. A huge gap under the door welcomed in the bugs.
The area behind the front door, which can't be seen when it's open, was filthy.
The experience was very unpleasant.

I've read the reviews & I'm not the only one pointing out issues. The Management responds with phrases like "We will keep this in mind for future improvements"
"Genuinely sorry your stay did not meet your expectations"
"Not a standard we aim to uphold"

Please Jawoyn Assoc, a few hundred dollars can fix a lot of these problems. It's not an expensive fix to add hooks in the bathroom, another side table, another chair, drinking water glasses, table lamps. Block out curtains.And clean behind doors.
showerReviews.author: Barbara M

locations.title: Adventure Playground

showerReviews.reviewText:
A comprehensive playground for a variety of ages. It doesn't look accessible to the public from the highway due to the white fence but it is open during the day.

There is a carpark with quite a few spots and two spots for people in wheelchairs. There is a flying fox and an all direction swing plus plenty more. There is a toddler playground and then another playground for primary then a playground section for middle primary to lower high school years.

There is a chilled drinking fountain and a BBQ. Plenty of shade with trees including grass areas and there are quality shade structures over the playgrounds and eating area where there are also two picnic tables. The shade structures are effective because the wind cools you down as you move around on the playground or sit at the picnic table. I wonder if more BBQs would be appropriate particularly during the dry season.

There are plenty of toilets and a toilet for people in wheelchairs.

Sadly vandalism has happened and parts of the playground have been damaged but the white fence around the playground might be preventing further damage.

The skate park is also next to the adventure playground with the recreation centre close by. The upgraded swimming pool will be completed next year which is also next to the carpark for the playground.

A special feature in Katherine particularly for families visiting or staying in Katherine. The information centre in Katherine should promote it to families.

A thank you message is certainly relevant to the local council for providing a quality and diverse playground with quality shade.
showerReviews.author: Henry Trewren
